title: Job Openings at NielsenIQ
content:
NielsenIQ is a global measurement and data analytics company that provides the most complete and trusted view available of consumers and markets worldwide. We provide consumer packaged goods manufacturers/fast-moving consumer goods and retailers with accurate, actionable information and insights and a complete picture of the complex and changing marketplace that companies need to innovate and grow. Our approach marries proprietary NielsenIQ data with other data sources to help clients around the world understand what’s happening now, what’s happening next, and how to best act on this knowledge.  We like to be in the middle of the action. That’s why you can find us at work in over 90 countries, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Research Executive

Job Location: Lagos

Responsibilities


	Drive client satisfaction by assisting with analysis and reporting;
	Strong understanding of data collected and ensure accurate representation of the data in reporting and insights;
	Experienced with thematic and content analysis for data extraction;
	Strong interpersonal communication skills;
	Ability to develop quantitative questionnaires;
	Ability to analyze and interpret data in a challenging and insightful manner;
	Proficient presentation development skills to creatively bring data to life with story-telling and attractive reporting to client expectations;
	Efficient time management, ability to multi-task and detail oriented;
	Displays maturity and creative problem-solving skills in handling crises;
	Attend fieldwork (in person or virtually);
	Assist senior staff in managing the day-to-day administration of client service activities and coordinating with Project Management team for updates;
	Should be proactive in updating/highlighting senior leadership on progress of projects;
	Willingness to learn and should have positive attitude towards work;
	Disciplined work ethic with respect to client deadlines.


Requirements


	Minimum 6 months to one year of experience in quantitative research or statistical analysis;
	Minimum academic qualification – degree;
	Analytical, creative and has critical thinking skills;
	Strong command of PowerPoint and familiarity with Microsoft Excel;
	Team player with effective communication skills;
	Responsible, hardworking, and attentive to details;
	Fluency in English.


We Offer


	Work in an international, multicultural environment;
	Remote & flexible working module; 
	Access to learning platforms, mentorship programme, and educational support to keep developing your skills; 
	Employee Assistance Program for all functions and levels.


Click here to apply online

 

 

2.) SMB Sales Executive

Job Location: Lagos

About this Job


	As Business Development Individual in the SMB team, you will be part of the sales organization in NielsenIQ and will collaborate with the respective market Sales Team to generate revenue for the products you are assigned for Small and Medium Clients in your respective market.
	To be successful in this role, you should have a proven track sales record.
	We are looking for a team player who has strong bias for action, and an ability to ‘find a way’ to overcome barriers and challenges.
	You will build networks, and work on assignments and opportunities across borders, which will require strong written and verbal communication skills.
	Existing/Previous knowledge and exposure to NielsenIQ retail measurement data will be a plus.


Responsibilites


	Approaching new whitespace clients to increase the client base; Pitching to the new client and explaining them the NIQ products and offerings
	Working on client proposals, costing, feasibilities & RFPs
	Coordinating & collaborating with internal teams for smooth client experience
	Supporting the team to achieve revenue target and business results by championing a client-centric sales mindset
	To drive and champion a sales and growth mindset within the organization
	To manage the BD pipeline and maintenance of the internal documents, trackers and adherence to the KPIs / SLAs.


A Little Bit About You


	Curiosity drives your interest in what moves the market.
	A proven sales person, who can build and execute sales strategy and plan.
	A team player, who has the ability to collaborate with peers, and contribute to the management team of NIQ Kenya.
	You’ll be responsible for listening to, discovering and understanding client needs to identify sales opportunities by leveraging NielsenIQ’s unique value proposition.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in relevant field
	2-3 years of working experience and proven sales results
	Strategic sales and business development competency will be a plus.
	Excellent client management and relationship building skills and ability to converse with stakeholders in clients’ organizations, up to C-Suite level
	Knowledge and understanding of strategy and the use of market data
	Related industries include: Consumer Packaged Goods, Consultative Sales, B2B
	Master full sales process from lead generation to closing sales.


Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) Market Research Business Development Lead

Job Location: Lagos
Career Site Team: Sales

Responsibilities


	Meet or exceed revenue target
	Build client relationships through engagement, identifies business opportunities
	Negotiate and close business deals and maintain extensive knowledge of NielsenIQ solutions as well as current market conditions
	Maintain relationships with current clients, supporting and directly servicing part of the coming client requests  
	Day-to-day execution of set team sales targets following company strategy  
	Approach potential new customers, present to them, ultimately convert them into clients and grow business with them
	Prepare Client proposals, contracts, orders to invoice
	Supports maintenance of the revenue related documents, materials, tracking files
	Drive and execute sales campaigns in close collaboration with Delivery teams.


 Qualifications


	Higher Education with a Degree preferable in Economics, Marketing, Business or similar
	At least 3 years of experience ideally from FMCG, distributor, retailer or marketing and/or research agency 
	Previous experience with NielsenIQ data and reports is a plus
	Easily adaptable to new business intelligence tools, such as SalesForce, Microsoft Dynamics, Salesloft and other online tools and platforms
	Good track record in previous analytical and/or sales roles
	Recommendation from the previous employer is a plus
	Very good knowledge of business English, both in writing and orally.


Benefits


	Flexible working environment
	Volunteer time off
	LinkedIn Learning
	Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP).


Click here to apply online    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Front-End & UI / UX Developer (Web, Mobile & Desktop)",
  "description": "AMO-HR Solutions is a trusted human resource firm dedicated to connecting businesses with the right talent. We specialize in matching organizations with skilled, passionate, and purpose-driven professionals who make a real impact.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Front-End &amp; UI / UX Developer (Web, Mobile &amp; Desktop)
Job Location:&nbsp;Ode-Remo, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Overview


	We are seeking a highly skilled and creative Front-End Developer with proven UI/UX design expertise to join our technology team.
	This is a dual-role position that requires strong hands-on experience in both front-end development and UI/UX design.
	The ideal candidate will not only build high-performance, responsive applications but also design intuitive and user-centered interfaces.
	You will be responsible for delivering seamless, engaging experiences across web, mobile, and desktop platforms, turning complex satellite and geospatial data into clear, impactful visual insights.


Key Responsibilities
Front-End Development:


	Design and develop responsive interfaces for web, mobile, and desktop applications using frameworks such as React, Angular, Vue.js, or Flutter.
	Integrate front-end applications with APIs to deliver real-time satellite imagery, analytics, and insights.
	Optimize applications for cross-platform and cross-browser compatibility, performance, and scalability.
	Conduct unit and integration testing to ensure reliability and functionality.


UI/UX Design:


	Lead and implement UI/UX processes from wireframes to high-fidelity designs.
	Use tools such as Figma, Sketch, Adobe XD, or InVision to create user-centered designs.
	Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams (GIS analysts, product managers, cybersecurity experts) to translate complex data into intuitive user experiences.
	Ensure accessibility, usability, and consistency across all platforms.


Collaboration &amp; Innovation:


	Work with GIS analysts to design interactive maps, dashboards, and geospatial visualizations.
	Partner with cybersecurity professionals to safeguard front-end applications against vulnerabilities.
	Maintain documentation for design systems, UI components, and integration workflows.
	Stay updated with the latest in front-end frameworks, UI/UX best practices, and emerging design trends.


Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s or Master&rsquo;s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Human-Computer Interaction, or related field.
	Minimum of 3 years of professional experience in front-end development with strong, demonstrable UI/UX design expertise.
	Proficiency in JavaScript/TypeScript, HTML, CSS, and frameworks like React, Angular, or Vue.js.
	Proven ability to design and deliver high-quality UI/UX using tools such as Figma, Adobe XD, Sketch, or InVision.
	Strong grasp of responsive design, accessibility standards, and user-centered design principles.
	Excellent debugging, testing, and documentation skills.
	Ability to balance design creativity with technical execution.


Preferred Qualifications:


	Experience with geospatial visualization libraries (Leaflet, Mapbox, CesiumJS).
	Familiarity with mobile development (React Native or Flutter).
	Knowledge of WebGL or 3D data visualization.
	Understanding of front-end security and data protection practices.
	Experience with real-time data feeds, IoT, or telemetry-based interfaces.
	Contributions to open-source front-end or UI/UX projects.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their updated CV, a portfolio or links to past projects, and Proof of hands-on experience to:&nbsp;hr@proforcegalaxies.com&nbsp;cc:&nbsp;amohrsolutions@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

  "validThrough": "2025-11-18",

Front-End & UI / UX Developer (Web, Mobile & Desktop) Job at AMO-HR Solutions




        
    

        
        AMO-HR Solutions is a trusted human resource firm dedicated to connecting businesses with the right talent. We specialize in matching organizations with skilled, passionate, and purpose-driven professionals who make a real impact.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Front-End & UI / UX Developer (Web, Mobile & Desktop)
Job Location: Ode-Remo, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Overview
     

            
    




	We are seeking a highly skilled and creative Front-End Developer with proven UI/UX design expertise to join our technology team.
	This is a dual-role position that requires strong hands-on experience in both front-end development and UI/UX design.
	The ideal candidate will not only build high-performance, responsive applications but also design intuitive and user-centered interfaces.
	You will be responsible for delivering seamless, engaging experiences across web, mobile, and desktop platforms, turning complex satellite and geospatial data into clear, impactful visual insights.


Key Responsibilities
Front-End Development:


	Design and develop responsive interfaces for web, mobile, and desktop applications using frameworks such as React, Angular, Vue.js, or Flutter.
	Integrate front-end applications with APIs to deliver real-time satellite imagery, analytics, and insights.
	Optimize applications for cross-platform and cross-browser compatibility, performance, and scalability.
	Conduct unit and integration testing to ensure reliability and functionality.


UI/UX Design:


	Lead and implement UI/UX processes from wireframes to high-fidelity designs.
	Use tools such as Figma, Sketch, Adobe XD, or InVision to create user-centered designs.
	Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams (GIS analysts, product managers, cybersecurity experts) to translate complex data into intuitive user experiences.
	Ensure accessibility, usability, and consistency across all platforms.


Collaboration & Innovation:


	Work with GIS analysts to design interactive maps, dashboards, and geospatial visualizations.
	Partner with cybersecurity professionals to safeguard front-end applications against vulnerabilities.
	Maintain documentation for design systems, UI components, and integration workflows.
	Stay updated with the latest in front-end frameworks, UI/UX best practices, and emerging design trends.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Human-Computer Interaction, or related field.
	Minimum of 3 years of professional experience in front-end development with strong, demonstrable UI/UX design expertise.
	Proficiency in JavaScript/TypeScript, HTML, CSS, and frameworks like React, Angular, or Vue.js.
	Proven ability to design and deliver high-quality UI/UX using tools such as Figma, Adobe XD, Sketch, or InVision.
	Strong grasp of responsive design, accessibility standards, and user-centered design principles.
	Excellent debugging, testing, and documentation skills.
	Ability to balance design creativity with technical execution.


Preferred Qualifications:


	Experience with geospatial visualization libraries (Leaflet, Mapbox, CesiumJS).
	Familiarity with mobile development (React Native or Flutter).
	Knowledge of WebGL or 3D data visualization.
	Understanding of front-end security and data protection practices.
	Experience with real-time data feeds, IoT, or telemetry-based interfaces.
	Contributions to open-source front-end or UI/UX projects.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their updated CV, a portfolio or links to past projects, and Proof of hands-on experience to: hr@proforcegalaxies.com cc: amohrsolutions@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Executive Sales Officer",
  "description": "Ascentech Services Limited is a full-fledged Human Resource Solution Provider incorporated in 2013 with its Head Office in Lagos, Nigeria. We are committed to forging long-term partnerships with our clients by creating and delivering robust and flexible services that address the changing needs of their business.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Executive Sales Officer
Job Location:&nbsp;Adeola Odeku, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	As a Showroom Sales Personnel, you will be responsible for selling the company&rsquo;s extensive range of furniture and achieving or exceeding sales targets.
	Serve as a brand ambassador, ensuring strong local brand awareness.
	Promote and drive sales to meet daily, monthly, and quarterly targets.
	Collaborate with sales and production teams to plan and execute seasonal furniture promotions.
	Proactively generate orders and close sales using showroom stock, catalogues, and client consultations on various furniture and fabric options.
	Present custom-order alternatives, including suitable fabric and hardware selections.
	Maintain and update the accessories inventory database and ensure display accessories are clean, well-presented, and regularly refreshed.
	Contribute to the creation and annual review of Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs).
	Oversee the visual appearance of the showroom, ensuring furniture presentation aligns with merchandising standards, seasonal layouts, and visual display guidelines.
	Liaise with sales and procurement managers to ensure stock availability and confirm full payment before delivery.
	Maintain attention to detail by completing daily order checklists to prevent delays and errors.
	Pass along retail leads generated from showroom visits to the wider sales team to maximise opportunities.
	Ensure the showroom, storeroom, and ancillary areas are always clean, tidy, and organised.
	Verify that all stock is correctly labelled, priced, and includes fabric and dimension details.
	Ensure catalogues, swatches, and samples are available at all times.
	Maintain a consistent sales presence in the showroom during operating hours.


Ideal Qualifications


	B.Sc. Degree or HND in Marketing or a related field.
	2&ndash;4 years of sales experience, preferably within the furniture industry.
	Degree or Diploma in Interior Decoration from a recognised/accredited institution in Nigeria.
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills.


Salary
N200,000 - N250,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;cv@ascentech.com.ng&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Executive Sales Officer Job at Ascentech Services Limited




        
    

        
        Ascentech Services Limited is a full-fledged Human Resource Solution Provider incorporated in 2013 with its Head Office in Lagos, Nigeria. We are committed to forging long-term partnerships with our clients by creating and delivering robust and flexible services that address the changing needs of their business.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Executive Sales Officer
Job Location: Adeola Odeku, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	As a Showroom Sales Personnel, you will be responsible for selling the company’s extensive range of furniture and achieving or exceeding sales targets.
	Serve as a brand ambassador, ensuring strong local brand awareness.
	Promote and drive sales to meet daily, monthly, and quarterly targets.
	Collaborate with sales and production teams to plan and execute seasonal furniture promotions.
	Proactively generate orders and close sales using showroom stock, catalogues, and client consultations on various furniture and fabric options.
	Present custom-order alternatives, including suitable fabric and hardware selections.
	Maintain and update the accessories inventory database and ensure display accessories are clean, well-presented, and regularly refreshed.
	Contribute to the creation and annual review of Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs).
	Oversee the visual appearance of the showroom, ensuring furniture presentation aligns with merchandising standards, seasonal layouts, and visual display guidelines.
	Liaise with sales and procurement managers to ensure stock availability and confirm full payment before delivery.
	Maintain attention to detail by completing daily order checklists to prevent delays and errors.
	Pass along retail leads generated from showroom visits to the wider sales team to maximise opportunities.
	Ensure the showroom, storeroom, and ancillary areas are always clean, tidy, and organised.
	Verify that all stock is correctly labelled, priced, and includes fabric and dimension details.
	Ensure catalogues, swatches, and samples are available at all times.
	Maintain a consistent sales presence in the showroom during operating hours.


Ideal Qualifications


	B.Sc. Degree or HND in Marketing or a related field.
	2–4 years of sales experience, preferably within the furniture industry.
	Degree or Diploma in Interior Decoration from a recognised/accredited institution in Nigeria.
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills.


Salary
N200,000 - N250,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: cv@ascentech.com.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Structural Design Engineer",
  "description": "Borderlesshr -&nbsp;Our model is predicated on empowering businesses like yours to build their engineering team without the risk, hassle or cost. You let us know what you want and we build your team from our diverse global pool of thoroughly pre-vetted software engineers.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Structural Design Engineer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time

Description


	We are seeking a highly skilled&nbsp;Structural Design Engineer&nbsp;to join our team.
	The successful candidate will be responsible for designing, analyzing, and optimizing structural systems for various projects, ensuring safety, durability, and compliance with industry standards and regulations.
	You will collaborate closely with architects, project managers, and construction teams to develop innovative, sustainable, and cost-effective structural solutions.


Key Responsibilities
Structural Analysis &amp; Design:


	Perform structural calculations and simulations for industrial, residential, and commercial buildings.
	Design steel, concrete, timber, and composite structures in compliance with international codes (ACI, AISC, Eurocodes, etc.).
	Develop structural models using software such as ETABS, SAP2000, STAAD Pro, or similar tools.
	Prepare structural design drawings, specifications, and reports.
	Analyze structures to determine their ability to withstand loads, pressures, and environmental factors.


Project Management:


	Assist in project planning, scheduling, and material selection.
	Recommend suitable construction materials considering strength, durability, cost, and sustainability.


Collaboration &amp; Coordination:


	Work closely with architects, contractors, and other engineers to ensure seamless integration of structural designs.
	Provide technical support during construction and address site queries or modifications.
	Review and approve shop drawings and submittals for compliance with design specifications.


Inspection &amp; Assessment:


	Conduct site inspections to verify structural integrity and adherence to design specifications.
	Resolve structural issues that arise during construction to maintain design integrity.


Compliance &amp; Safety:


	Ensure all designs meet local regulations and international building codes.
	Conduct risk assessments and implement appropriate safety measures.


Research &amp; Innovation:


	Stay updated on advancements in structural engineering technologies and materials.
	Explore innovative design techniques to enhance sustainability and cost-effectiveness.
	Apply value engineering principles to optimize structural performance.


Documentation:


	Prepare detailed reports, drawings, and specifications for clients, contractors, and regulatory bodies.
	Collaborate with architects and draftsmen to produce construction-ready blueprints.
	Ensure accuracy and clarity in all design documentation.


Qualifications &amp; Experience


	Education:&nbsp;Master&rsquo;s degree in&nbsp;Structural Engineering&nbsp;from an accredited institution.
	Certification:&nbsp;COREN Certification is required.
	Experience:&nbsp;Minimum of&nbsp;10 years&nbsp;managing design aspects of large-scale projects.


Skills &amp; Competencies


	Strong knowledge of&nbsp;construction materials,&nbsp;geotechnical principles, and&nbsp;seismic design.
	Proficiency in&nbsp;structural analysis and design software&nbsp;(ETABS, SAP2000, STAAD Pro, etc.).
	Solid understanding of&nbsp;local and international building codes&nbsp;and safety regulations.
	Ability to design steel, concrete, timber, and composite structures.
	Excellent&nbsp;communication,&nbsp;teamwork, and&nbsp;collaboration&nbsp;skills.
	Strong&nbsp;analytical thinking,&nbsp;problem-solving, and&nbsp;attention to detail.
	Good&nbsp;project management&nbsp;and documentation skills.


Budget
N800,000 (monthly gross).

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their&nbsp;resume to:&nbsp;amy4recruitment@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

  "validThrough": "2025-11-04",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

Structural Design Engineer Job at Borderlesshr




        
    

        
        Borderlesshr - Our model is predicated on empowering businesses like yours to build their engineering team without the risk, hassle or cost. You let us know what you want and we build your team from our diverse global pool of thoroughly pre-vetted software engineers.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Structural Design Engineer

Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Description
     

            
    




	We are seeking a highly skilled Structural Design Engineer to join our team.
	The successful candidate will be responsible for designing, analyzing, and optimizing structural systems for various projects, ensuring safety, durability, and compliance with industry standards and regulations.
	You will collaborate closely with architects, project managers, and construction teams to develop innovative, sustainable, and cost-effective structural solutions.


Key Responsibilities
Structural Analysis & Design:


	Perform structural calculations and simulations for industrial, residential, and commercial buildings.
	Design steel, concrete, timber, and composite structures in compliance with international codes (ACI, AISC, Eurocodes, etc.).
	Develop structural models using software such as ETABS, SAP2000, STAAD Pro, or similar tools.
	Prepare structural design drawings, specifications, and reports.
	Analyze structures to determine their ability to withstand loads, pressures, and environmental factors.


Project Management:


	Assist in project planning, scheduling, and material selection.
	Recommend suitable construction materials considering strength, durability, cost, and sustainability.


Collaboration & Coordination:


	Work closely with architects, contractors, and other engineers to ensure seamless integration of structural designs.
	Provide technical support during construction and address site queries or modifications.
	Review and approve shop drawings and submittals for compliance with design specifications.


Inspection & Assessment:


	Conduct site inspections to verify structural integrity and adherence to design specifications.
	Resolve structural issues that arise during construction to maintain design integrity.


Compliance & Safety:


	Ensure all designs meet local regulations and international building codes.
	Conduct risk assessments and implement appropriate safety measures.


Research & Innovation:


	Stay updated on advancements in structural engineering technologies and materials.
	Explore innovative design techniques to enhance sustainability and cost-effectiveness.
	Apply value engineering principles to optimize structural performance.


Documentation:


	Prepare detailed reports, drawings, and specifications for clients, contractors, and regulatory bodies.
	Collaborate with architects and draftsmen to produce construction-ready blueprints.
	Ensure accuracy and clarity in all design documentation.


Qualifications & Experience


	Education: Master’s degree in Structural Engineering from an accredited institution.
	Certification: COREN Certification is required.
	Experience: Minimum of 10 years managing design aspects of large-scale projects.


Skills & Competencies


	Strong knowledge of construction materials, geotechnical principles, and seismic design.
	Proficiency in structural analysis and design software (ETABS, SAP2000, STAAD Pro, etc.).
	Solid understanding of local and international building codes and safety regulations.
	Ability to design steel, concrete, timber, and composite structures.
	Excellent communication, teamwork, and collaboration skills.
	Strong analytical thinking, problem-solving, and attention to detail.
	Good project management and documentation skills.


Budget
N800,000 (monthly gross).

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their resume to: amy4recruitment@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

            
    




   


    
        Similar Jobs

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Human Resources Officer",
  "description": "New Incentives is a pioneer in a growing movement of giving small incentives to caregivers whose infants get immunized, while increasing awareness of the health benefits of childhood vaccinations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Human Resources Officer

Job Locations:&nbsp;Sokoto, Kebbi and Zamfara
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Human Resources Officer will be assisting the HR Manager in recruitment, employee relations management, staff benefits administration, staff compensation, staff performance management, and training.
	The ideal candidate should be someone with at least 3 years experience in Human Resources, very diligent, detailed, and process oriented with some understanding of legal and logistics processes.
	The candidate should be residing in North West Nigeria. Excellent communication skills, a learning mindset, and ability to adapt quickly managing HR systems are essential to succeed in this role.


Job Responsibilities and Tasks
Recruitment (30%):


	Assist in FOs selection and in-person interviews at the LGAs level.
	Take the lead to manage in-person interviews of shortlisted FOs candidates through local New Incentives team members.
	Escalate any gaps, challenges, or noncompliance to the HR Manager for immediate follow-up.
	Liaise with the SR unit and community leaders to ensure locals are recruited.
	Promote job ads on social media and do outreaches on platforms like LinkedIn and your network to identify candidates.
	Assist the HR Manager in sending invitations, following up with candidates through phone calls, scheduling interviews, and conducting reference and background checks.
	Send feedback for the concluded recruitment exercise.
	Prepare the recruitment Gsheet during and after the process.


Onboarding, Benefits and Compensation Management (40%):


	Follow up with the new employees to ensure pension and NHF registration are done, and numbers are generated.
	Follow up with the new office account opening during onboarding.
	Liaise with PFAs, NHF, NSITF, and tax offices to follow up on remittances.
	Physical Training sessions for new hires in the state.


Administration (30%):


	Ensure employee information is up to date.
	Review employee leave applications on Zoho and ensure the proper documents are uploaded.
	Any other duty that the HR Manager or console may assign.


Education and Work Experience Requirements


	BSc or BA Degree in Business Administration, Social Sciences or its recognized equivalent
	At least 2 - 5 years in a Human Resources general function.
	1 - 2 years of prior experience working for a non-profit, charitable organization, NGO or (I)NGO is a plus
	Priority will be given to candidates residing in the states where the position is advertised.


Skills and Competencies Requirement:


	Preferably a candidate already based in Sokoto, Zamfara, or Kebbi States or willing to relocate to either of the States
	Detail-oriented and diligent professional
	Process-oriented with some understanding of legal and logistics processes
	Good networks and contacts in North West Nigeria and ability to leverage for recruitment
	Good organizational skills, effective time management, ability to meet deadlines, multi-task, and prioritize tasks
	Sound cultural awareness and ability to work in multicultural and multiethnic environments
	Proven managerial and/or leadership skills
	Ability to deliver high-quality work in short periods and to work under pressure.
	Critical thinker and possess a problem-solving attitude
	Passion to help others and reduce infant mortality
	Very good communication and writing skills, English, Hausa and dialects (verbal and written)
	Excellent responsiveness to email and phone requests
	Proficiency in MS Word, MS Excel, MS PowerPoint, internet browsers, smartphones, and ICT in general. The candidate should be willing to use Google Docs, Google Sheets, and Google Slides.
	Motivation to work in a young organization that is constantly changing based on stakeholder feedback and operates with a lean structure.


Language Requirement


	Proficiency in English Language (conversation, reading and writing) is required
	Knowledge of Hausa Language (conversation and reading) is an advantage.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-10-13",
  "validThrough": "2025-10-28",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "New Incentives"
    
  },

      "addressCountry": "NG"

      "maxValue": 0,

    }
  }
}



Human Resources Officer Job at New Incentives




        
    

        
        New Incentives is a pioneer in a growing movement of giving small incentives to caregivers whose infants get immunized, while increasing awareness of the health benefits of childhood vaccinations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resources Officer

Job Locations: Sokoto, Kebbi and Zamfara
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The Human Resources Officer will be assisting the HR Manager in recruitment, employee relations management, staff benefits administration, staff compensation, staff performance management, and training.
	The ideal candidate should be someone with at least 3 years experience in Human Resources, very diligent, detailed, and process oriented with some understanding of legal and logistics processes.
	The candidate should be residing in North West Nigeria. Excellent communication skills, a learning mindset, and ability to adapt quickly managing HR systems are essential to succeed in this role.


Job Responsibilities and Tasks
Recruitment (30%):


	Assist in FOs selection and in-person interviews at the LGAs level.
	Take the lead to manage in-person interviews of shortlisted FOs candidates through local New Incentives team members.
	Escalate any gaps, challenges, or noncompliance to the HR Manager for immediate follow-up.
	Liaise with the SR unit and community leaders to ensure locals are recruited.
	Promote job ads on social media and do outreaches on platforms like LinkedIn and your network to identify candidates.
	Assist the HR Manager in sending invitations, following up with candidates through phone calls, scheduling interviews, and conducting reference and background checks.
	Send feedback for the concluded recruitment exercise.
	Prepare the recruitment Gsheet during and after the process.


Onboarding, Benefits and Compensation Management (40%):


	Follow up with the new employees to ensure pension and NHF registration are done, and numbers are generated.
	Follow up with the new office account opening during onboarding.
	Liaise with PFAs, NHF, NSITF, and tax offices to follow up on remittances.
	Physical Training sessions for new hires in the state.


Administration (30%):


	Ensure employee information is up to date.
	Review employee leave applications on Zoho and ensure the proper documents are uploaded.
	Any other duty that the HR Manager or console may assign.


Education and Work Experience Requirements


	BSc or BA Degree in Business Administration, Social Sciences or its recognized equivalent
	At least 2 - 5 years in a Human Resources general function.
	1 - 2 years of prior experience working for a non-profit, charitable organization, NGO or (I)NGO is a plus
	Priority will be given to candidates residing in the states where the position is advertised.


Skills and Competencies Requirement:


	Preferably a candidate already based in Sokoto, Zamfara, or Kebbi States or willing to relocate to either of the States
	Detail-oriented and diligent professional
	Process-oriented with some understanding of legal and logistics processes
	Good networks and contacts in North West Nigeria and ability to leverage for recruitment
	Good organizational skills, effective time management, ability to meet deadlines, multi-task, and prioritize tasks
	Sound cultural awareness and ability to work in multicultural and multiethnic environments
	Proven managerial and/or leadership skills
	Ability to deliver high-quality work in short periods and to work under pressure.
	Critical thinker and possess a problem-solving attitude
	Passion to help others and reduce infant mortality
	Very good communication and writing skills, English, Hausa and dialects (verbal and written)
	Excellent responsiveness to email and phone requests
	Proficiency in MS Word, MS Excel, MS PowerPoint, internet browsers, smartphones, and ICT in general. The candidate should be willing to use Google Docs, Google Sheets, and Google Slides.
	Motivation to work in a young organization that is constantly changing based on stakeholder feedback and operates with a lean structure.


Language Requirement


	Proficiency in English Language (conversation, reading and writing) is required
	Knowledge of Hausa Language (conversation and reading) is an advantage.
